snippet: Progress is reported in allowing an oversight board to inspect auditing firms in China whose clients issue securities traded in public markets in the United States.
abstract: Public Company Accounting Oversight Board announces that it will soon be able to oversee auditing firms that certify Chinese companies to be traded on public markets in the United States; agency had been frustrated by a standoff that prevented it from reviewing the audits of Chinese companies that turned out to be frauds.
lead_paragraph: Progress is reported in allowing an oversight board to inspect auditing firms in China whose clients issue securities traded in public markets in the United States.

headline.main: Regulator Predicts U.S. Will Soon Take Part in Chinese Inspections of Auditors
headline.print_headline: Regulator Predicts U.S. Will Soon Take Part in Chinese Inspections of Auditors
